However, players who wish to faithfully recreate the Space Wolves Chapter on the tabletop should only include* **SPACE WOLVES EPIC HEROES** *if their collection is intended to represent the First Founding Chapter itself; Logan Grimnar is the Great Wolf of the Space Wolves, for example, and not of any of their successors.*

While this unit is within 6" of one or more friendly **SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER** models (excluding **WULFEN** models) or within 12" of one or more friendly **WOLF PRIEST** models, if it is not Battle‑shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of **INFANTRY** models in it and add 3 to the Objective Control characteristic of **VEHICLE** models in it.
This ability is described in full on the Army Rules page of *Codex: Space Marines*.
Each Detachment rule in *Codex Supplement: Space Wolves* includes a Saga you can complete, with additional effects that apply once you have done so.

■ If an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit has a second Faction keyword on its datasheet, that Faction keyword is the name of that unit’s Chapter. For example, Ragnar Blackmane has both the **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** and **SPACE WOLVES** Faction keywords, and is therefore from the Space Wolves Chapter.
■ You cannot include units from more than one Chapter in your army.
■ If your army uses any of the Detachments from this book, it can include **SPACE WOLVES** units, but it cannot include any **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** units drawn from any other Chapter.

**Designer’s Note:** *The rules presented in this section assume that the* **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** *units in your army are from the Space Wolves Chapter, but they can also be used to represent any Space Wolves successor Chapter, such as one described in the background section of this book, or even one of your own invention. However, players who wish to faithfully recreate the Space Wolves Chapter on the tabletop should only include* **SPACE WOLVES EPIC HEROES** *if their collection is intended to represent the First Founding Chapter itself; Logan Grimnar is the Great Wolf of the Space Wolves, for example, and not of any of their successors.*

While this unit is within 6" of one or more friendly **SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER** models (excluding **WULFEN** models) or within 12" of one or more friendly **WOLF PRIEST** models, if it is not Battle‑shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of **INFANTRY** models in it and add 3 to the Objective Control characteristic of **VEHICLE** models in it.

Once per battle, in your Command phase, you can use this ability. If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model from your army with the Oath of Moment ability makes an attack that targets your Oath of Moment target, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

At the start of your Command phase, you can select one of the Combat Doctrines listed below. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Combat Doctrine is active and its effects apply to all **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** units from your army. You can only select each Combat Doctrine once per battle.
DEVASTATOR DOCTRINE
This unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.
TACTICAL DOCTRINE
This unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
ASSAULT DOCTRINE
This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
**ADEPTUS ASTARTES** units from your army are eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which they Advanced or Fell Back.

Each time an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** model from your army makes an attack, if that attack targets a **CHARACTER**, **MONSTER** or **VEHICLE** unit or if your Saga is completed (see below), that attack has the **[LETHAL HITS]** ability.
Saga of the Beastslayer

At the start of the first battle round, your Beastslayer tally is 0, and you determine your Beastslayer target by halving the number of units from your opponent’s army (including those embarked within **TRANSPORTS**) that have one or more of the following keywords (rounding up): **CHARACTER**, **MONSTER**, **VEHICLE**.

Each time an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit from your army shoots or fights, after all of those attacks have been resolved, add 1 to your Beastslayer tally for each enemy unit with one or more of the following keywords destroyed by those attacks: **CHARACTER**, **MONSTER**, **VEHICLE**.

Once your Beastslayer tally is equal to or greater than your Beastslayer target, your Saga is completed.

At the start of the battle round, select one of the following Psychic Disciplines. Until the end of the battle round, that Psychic Discipline is active and its effects apply to all **ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER** units from your army.
Biomancy Discipline
Add 2" to the Move characteristic of models in this unit.
Divination Discipline
Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1 and re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.
Pyromancy Discipline
Each time a ranged attack made by a model in this unit targets an enemy unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
Telekinesis Discipline
Each time a ranged attack targets this unit, subtract 1 from the Strength characteristic of that attack.
Telepathy Discipline
Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Weapon Skill or Ballistic Skill characteristics and/or any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.

Each time a ranged attack targets an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit from your army, unless the attacking model is within 12", subtract 1 from the Hit roll and the target has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

At the end of your opponent’s Charge phase, each **ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY** and **ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER** unit from your army that is within 3" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those units can declare a charge against one or more of those units, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase. If that charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

While **ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR** units from your army are not Battle‑shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in those units.

Each time a model in a **SPACE WOLVES** unit from your army makes a melee attack that targets an enemy unit, if that enemy unit is within Engagement Range of one or more other **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** units from your army, or if the attacking unit contains more models than that enemy unit:

■ Add 1 to the Hit roll.
■ If your Saga is completed (see below), add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
Saga of the Hunter

At the start of the first battle round, your Quarry tally is 0. Each time an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit from your army fights, after all of those attacks have been resolved, add 1 to your Quarry tally for each enemy unit destroyed by those attacks.

Once your Quarry tally is equal to or greater than the number shown in the table below (depending on the battle size), your Saga is completed.

Ranged weapons equipped by **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army have the **[HEAVY]** ability. If such a weapon already has this ability, each time an attack is made with that weapon, if the attacking model’s unit Remained Stationary this turn, add 1 to the Wound roll.

Each time an **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit from your army is selected to shoot or fight, apply one of the following when resolving those attacks:

■ If your Saga is completed (see below), you can re‑roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll and one Damage roll.
■ Otherwise, if that unit is a **SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER** unit, you can re‑roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll or one Damage roll.
Saga of the Bold

Each time a **SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER** unit from your army does one of the following, that unit achieves that Boast. Once three or more different Boasts have been achieved by units from your army, your Saga is completed.

■ **Your Hide as a Trophy:** That unit destroys your Oath of Moment target.
■ **Slay Them All:** That unit destroys your Oath of Moment target, and that is the second Oath of Moment target destroyed by that unit in this battle.
■ **Overrun Their Position:** At the end of either player’s turn, that unit is wholly within your opponent’s deployment zone.
■ **Hold the Line:** From the second battle round onwards, at the end of your Command phase, that unit is within range of an objective marker you control that is not within your deployment zone.

Ranged weapons equipped by **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army have the **[ASSAULT]** ability, and each time an attack made with such a weapon targets a unit within 12", add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack.
Once per phase for each **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** unit in your army, you can re-roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll or one Damage roll made for a model in that unit.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Heroes of the Chapter
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. If your unit is Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
stratagems.fluff: When the fighting is at its fiercest, the veteran warriors of the Chapter truly show their quality.

stratagems.name: Legendary Fortitude
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: Many are the legendary tales of the 1st Company holding their ground against the odds, weathering assaults that would have swept away lesser warriors.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Honour the Chapter
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] ability. If your unit is under the effects of the Assault Doctrine, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of such weapons by 1 as well.
stratagems.fluff: Every Chapter has forged its own tales of heroism, and none of its battle-brothers would see that noble record besmirched.

stratagems.name: Storm of Fire
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability. If your unit is under the effects of the Devastator Doctrine, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of such weapons by 1 as well.
stratagems.fluff: There is no escaping the wrath of the Space Marines, and they use their weapons to bring swift death to their foes wherever they may hide.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Blitzing Fusillade
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability. If such a weapon already has this ability, until the end of the phase, that weapon has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability as well.
stratagems.fluff: Warriors of Stormlance Task Forces can suddenly pour heavy and accurate fire into the enemy even as they race to finish off any survivors.

stratagems.name: Shock Assault
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, you can re-roll Charge rolls made for your unit and melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LANCE] ability.
stratagems.fluff: The Adeptus Astartes are elite troops who strike with all the speed and fury of a searing thunderbolt.

stratagems.name: Ride Hard, Ride Fast
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED or ADEPTUS ASTARTES FLY VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll and subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Like zephyrs dancing across wide horizons, Space Marine riders and pilots can weave lithely around incoming fire with incredible skill.

stratagems.name: Unbridled Ferocity
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: The Space Wolves fight with a savage fury that enables them to overcome even the most resilient targets.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Strike From The Shadows
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit that is more than 12" away, improve the Ballistic Skill and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as a result of those attacks, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model’s unit must take a Battle-shock test.
stratagems.fluff: To evade one’s enemies and sow confusion can be a deadly weapon in itself.

stratagems.name: Overwhelming Onslaught
stratagems.target: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit, or one SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Several packs converge upon a single target, pinning them in place with the weight of their bodies.

stratagems.name: Marked for Destruction
stratagems.target: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army (excluding BEASTS) that have not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit visible to both of your units. Until the end of the phase, models in your units can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and each time a model in one of your units makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.
stratagems.fluff: At the barked orders of their Pack Leaders, the Space Wolves focus their fury upon a single target, combining their firepower to bring the foe down.

stratagems.name: Battle Drill Recall
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If your unit Remained Stationary this turn, then until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
stratagems.fluff: Space Marines train for countless hours to master their weapons and in the heat of battle can trigger mnemonic patterning to recall their ritual drills and ensure the foe’s destruction.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Crucible of Battle
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest eligible target within 6", add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Only where the enemy can be faced eye to eye can a Space Marine be truly tested.

stratagems.name: Onslaught of Fire
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible target within 12", add 1 to the Hit roll. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of any of those attacks, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model’s unit must take a Battle-shock test.
stratagems.fluff: Armed with targeting data supplied by their transport’s augury gheists, warriors erupt from the assault ramps with weapons blazing in ruthless eradication patterns.

stratagems.name: Burning Vengeance
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TRANSPORT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
stratagems.effect: One unit embarked within that TRANSPORT can disembark as if it were your Movement phase, and can then shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
stratagems.fluff: To open fire on warriors of a Firestorm Assault Force is merely to invite one’s own swift destruction.

stratagems.name: Unbowed Conviction
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is below its Starting Strength.
stratagems.when: Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and/or to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).
stratagems.fluff: Space Marines exemplify obdurate tenacity. Even injured, they will never abandon their oaths.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post-human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Surgical Strikes
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Every tyrant must fear the assassin’s blade, and the vanguard spring ambushes with precision coordination

stratagems.name: No Threat Too Great
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: To combat an entrenched force of Space Marines, foes resort to armoured vehicles or packs of murderous monstrosities. Even the greatest of behemoths has a chink in its armour and the Adeptus Astartes are well versed in exploiting such weaknesses.

stratagems.name: Immolation Protocols
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, Torrent weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Salvo after salvo of burning promethium unleashed in synchronised waves will leave almost any foe as smouldering ash.

stratagems.name: Mercy Is Weakness
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, and when making such an attack, if the attacking model is a VEHICLE, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
stratagems.fluff: Once a foe is marked for destruction, the Angels of Death must not relent until the target is annihilated.

stratagems.name: Inspiring Presence
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: The inspiring presence of a champion lends their pack’s strikes lethal impetus.

stratagems.name: Champion’s Guidance
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re‑roll the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: A paragon of Fenrisian savagery, this champion guides his warriors with confidence and precision.

stratagems.name: Birth of a Saga
stratagems.target: One Wolf Guard Headtaker or Wolf Guard Terminator Pack Leader model from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect:
Until the start of your next Command phase, your model has the CHARACTER keyword.

Designer’s Note: While in effect, your model’s unit is therefore a CHARACTER unit, meaning it can interact with the Heroes All rule (see Detachment Rules section), in addition to other rules that interact with CHARACTER units.
stratagems.fluff: Heroes are forged in the heat of battle, rising from obscurity to become the warriors of epic sagas.

stratagems.name: Alpha Strike
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
stratagems.fluff: A true alpha wolf leads by example, and is always first into the fray.

stratagems.name: Vengeful Animus
stratagems.target: That ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE model. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE model from your army with the Deadly Demise ability is destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Do not roll one D6 to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your model’s Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted.
stratagems.fluff: Carefully cogitated binharic prayers can focus a machine spirit’s ire into near-obsessive hatred of its slayers, ensuring that vengeance is meted out even in death.

stratagems.name: Ancient Fury
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER model from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, improve your model’s Move, Toughness, Leadership and Objective Control characteristics by 1 and each time your model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: The heroes entombed within Dreadnoughts have fought across countless war zones throughout their extended existences, perfecting their martial prowess beyond mortal limits.

stratagems.name: Power of the Machine Spirit
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE unit from your army that was reduced to Below Half-strength as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
stratagems.fluff: There are many tales of machine spirits wreaking havoc on the foe, even after the crew of their vehicle are slain and critical systems are failing.

stratagems.name: Only in Death Does Duty End
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: Imminent death does not prevent a Space Marine from enacting their final justice upon the enemies of the Imperium.

stratagems.name: Heroic Resolve
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: This warrior’s indomitable fortitude is the stuff of legend, galvanizing his pack to remain standing before an avalanche of incoming attacks.

stratagems.name: Countercharge
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit now declares a charge that targets only one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase. Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Bellowing encouragement, this warrior rallies his pack and leads a furious counterstrike, intercepting the enemy advance before it can fall upon his allies.

stratagems.name: Terrifying Proficiency
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.
stratagems.fluff: The 1st Company’s veterans unleash their skills with an efficiency that is harrowing to witness.

stratagems.name: Duty and Honour
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: Adeptus Astartes veterans claim critical objectives in daring strikes, annihilating resistance in their Chapter’s name before sweeping onto their next target.

stratagems.name: Orbital Teleportarium
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. It will arrive back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: Teleportarium chambers within orbiting strike cruisers are able to perform site-to-strike teleportations for Terminator-armoured battle-brothers in extremis.

stratagems.name: Adaptive Strategy
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select the Devastator Doctrine, Tactical Doctrine or Assault Doctrine. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Combat Doctrine is active for that unit instead of any other Combat Doctrine that is active for your army, even if you have already selected that Combat Doctrine this battle.
stratagems.fluff: The tenets of the Codex Astartes allow for unorthodox use of combat tactics and the employment of divergent doctrines if doing so will lead to victory.

stratagems.name: Squad Tactics
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or a Normal move of up to 6" instead if it is under the effects of the Tactical Doctrine.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: Space Marines know precisely when to give ground in order to leave their enemies floundering, before surging back into the fight and driving them from the field in disarray.

stratagems.name: Wind-swift Evasion
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: Space Marines are loathe to be brought into combat on any others’ terms, especially the warriors of Stormlance Task Forces, whose battlefield tactics revolve around speed and precise, ferocious assaults.

stratagems.name: Shock Cavalry
stratagems.target: One THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models) and sections of terrain features that are 4" or less in height. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.
stratagems.fluff: Thunderwolf Cavalry bound through friend and foe, leaping over obstacles in pursuit of their foes.

stratagems.name: Pinning Fire
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, after your unit has shot, select one enemy CHARACTER, MONSTER, or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that unit is pinned. While a unit is pinned, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it.
stratagems.fluff: Unleashing a storm of firepower, the Space Wolves pin their targets down and halt their advance.

stratagems.name: Thunderous Pursuit
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". If your unit has the SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY keywords, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.
stratagems.fluff: The relentless endurance of thunderwolf steeds enables the Space Wolves to run down fleeing foes.

stratagems.name: Impetuosity
stratagems.target: One WULFEN INFANTRY or BLOOD CLAWS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, after that enemy unit has shot, if one or more models in your unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, your unit can make an Impetuous move. To do so, roll one D6: your unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Severe losses only drive Blood Claws and Wulfen forward into the midst of the foe.

stratagems.name: Coordinated Strike
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: Space Wolves officers rein in their warriors’ impulsive fury, repositioning them to strike exposed flanks.

stratagems.name: Sensory Assault
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit that is within 18" of and visible to one PSYKER model in your unit. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is pinned. While a unit is pinned, subtract 2 from that unit’s Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. In addition, if the Telepathy Discipline is active for your army, that enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.
stratagems.fluff: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the Librarian alters his foes’ perceptions.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their post‑human physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.

stratagems.name: Fiery Shield
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that is within 18" of one or more friendly ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER models, and that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll, and if the Pyromancy Discipline is active for your army, weapons that target your unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: As the enemy closes in for the kill, the psyker manifests his psychic will in a raging inferno that obscures imperilled allies and threatens to immolate any who come close enough to land a blow upon them.

stratagems.name: Iron Arm
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that is within 18" of one or more ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER models from your army and has not been selected to Fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit, or add 2 if the Biomancy Discipline is active for your army.
stratagems.fluff: This Librarian lends skull‑shattering weight and impact to melee strikes by transmuting flesh into unyielding metal.

stratagems.name: Assail
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER unit from your army that is eligible to shoot.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to one or more PSYKER models in your unit (excluding units with the Lone Operative ability), and roll six D6, adding 1 to each result if the Telekinesis Discipline is active for your army: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
stratagems.fluff: Using nothing but the power of his mind, a Librarian can rip rubble, boulders and other debris from the surrounding terrain and hurl them at the foe.

stratagems.name: Prescient Precision
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES PSYKER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability, and the [IGNORES COVER] ability as well if the Divination Discipline is active for your army.
stratagems.fluff: Sharing some of his prescience with his battle‑brothers, a Librarian can guide their fire.

stratagems.name: Calculated Feint
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit declares a charge.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or up to 6" instead if it is a PHOBOS or SCOUT SQUAD unit.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: A feigned retreat can be used to overextend eager foes or draw them into deadly arcs of fire.

stratagems.name: Guerrilla Tactics
stratagems.target: Up to two PHOBOS and/or SCOUT SQUAD units from your army, or one other ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.restrictions: Each unit selected for this Stratagem must be more than 3" away from all enemy models.
stratagems.fluff: At the opportune moment, Space Marine infiltration units slip away from battle, only to relocate ready to strike the foe again.

stratagems.name: Chilling Howl
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if that unit is Below Half‑strength.
stratagems.fluff: Raising their feral voices as one, the elite champions of Fenris give voice to a predatory howl fit to freeze the marrow of the bravest warriors.

stratagems.name: Stalking Wolves
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Stealth ability.
stratagems.fluff: These veteran warriors approach the foe like wolves on the hunt. They are ever‑poised to drop into cover or fade into the shadows to avoid their prey’s increasingly desperate attempts to drive them of.

stratagems.name: Onrushing Storm
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: A Fenrisian gunship skims low over the battlefield, touching down just long enough for these elite warriors to embark before it lifts off again. The enemy’s respite will not last long; it will return with its deadly cargo soon enough.

stratagems.name: Preytaker’s Eye
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] abilities. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have that ability.
stratagems.fluff: Long and bloody experience has taught these warriors how best to identify the slightest weakness in their prey and exploit it to the fullest.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.

stratagems.name: Runes of Claiming
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: A few quick cuts with a diamond‑keen hunting knife or energised claw tip leave Fenrisian runes carved into bedrock, plasteel or flesh, marks of abjuration against the foe and secret messages between Space Wolves alike.

stratagems.name: Envelop and Ensnare
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". When doing so, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: The Space Wolves close in on their foes, some packs hurling themselves upon the enemy whilst others move to cut off retreat routes.

stratagems.name: Territorial Advantage
stratagems.target: That ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit is destroyed by an ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: The wolf packs are ever on the move, seizing ground and repelling their foes with savage violence.

stratagems.name: Chosen Prey
stratagems.target: That SPACE WOLVES unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a SPACE WOLVES unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Having singled out their prey, the pack repeatedly strikes in waves, bleeding the target with each hit.

stratagems.name: Bounding Advance
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.
stratagems.fluff: Fenrisian warriors and wolves surge forward, driving through the enemy line to outflank the foe.

stratagems.name: Rigid Discipline
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can immediately make a Fall Back move of up to 6".
stratagems.restrictions: When making that move, your unit must end that move either wholly within your deployment zone or within range of an objective marker.
stratagems.fluff: Cleaving to duty, the Adeptus Astartes refuse to be drawn out of position. Instead they secure ground to establish new fire lines to the enemy.

stratagems.name: Not One Backwards Step
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army within range of an objective marker.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, double the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit, but it must Remain Stationary this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Siege warfare is incomparably brutal. Space Marines battle with the fiercest determination to achieve victory, and will fight unto death to hold every defensive line or to secure gains they have wrested from the enemy.

stratagems.name: Rapid Embarkation
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TRANSPORT unit from your army that has no models embarked within it, and one ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT.
stratagems.when: End of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Your Infantry unit can embark within that TRANSPORT.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target an INFANTRY unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, that cannot normally embark within that TRANSPORT, or that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.
stratagems.fluff: No time can be wasted in punishing the Emperor’s foes. Many are those that deserve death and once one enemy is vanquished, soon must another follow.

stratagems.name: Hail of Vengeance
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
stratagems.fluff: Space Marines’ incredible battlefield awareness enables them to instinctively identify the origin of any enemy fire and punish their attackers.

stratagems.name: A Deadly Prize
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
stratagems.when: Start of the Command phase.
stratagems.effect: That objective marker is said to be Sabotaged, and remains under your control even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. While an objective marker is Sabotaged and under your control, each time an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move within range of that objective marker, roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
stratagems.fluff: Warriors of a Vanguard Spearhead will rig critical objectives with explosives to deny them to the enemy.

stratagems.name: Full Throttle
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED or ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE unit (excluding WALKERS) from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit, or 9" instead if your unit is Mounted.
stratagems.fluff: On the eve of riding down the most elusive prey, the task force’s expert Techmarines will entreat the engine spirits of their vehicles, honing the iron steeds’ performance to elicit even more speed from them.
